basics.name: Gabriel Silva
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate in Computer Science
basics.summary: Ph.D. Candidate in Computer Science (Expected 2026) specializing in Natural Language Processing and Knowledge Graphs. Expertise in fusing Large Language Models (LLMs) with Graph Machine Learning for Open Information Extraction. Proven track record of publishing in top-tier venues (ACL Workshops, LREC) and securing competitive research funding. Committed to delivering high-quality research and fostering positive relationships within teams.

work.name: IEETA / Universidade de Aveiro
work.summary: Research focused on multi-lingual Open Information Extraction, specifically for Portuguese, by merging Knowledge Graphs with Language Models.
highlights: Won funding for the project 'Natural Language Processing based on Graph Machine Learning and Deep Learning for Information Extraction' (RNCA and Google Cloud, 2nd edition). Project awarded 100% funding and a grade of 9.22/10.
Published several papers on NLP, Knowledge Management, Open Information Extraction, and Named Entity Recognition.
Collaborated with researchers in tourism and chemistry on Machine Learning projects, leading to additional publications.
Spent a semester abroad at Linköping University fostering relationships between Research Units and collaborating with their NLP group.
Part of the Organization Committee for SLATE'24 (Symposium on Languages, Applications and Technologies) and IberSPEECH'25.

work.name: ESTGA - Universidade de Aveiro
work.summary: Teaching responsibilities for Masters and Bachelor students.
highlights: Taught classes focused on Knowledge Graph Databases and Object Oriented Programming.
Graded and created tests and assignments.
Maintained regular office hours to provide struggling students with additional course help.

work.name: G-Lok Systems
work.summary: Development of an Android app and Web Page for visualization of GPS signals by trucks using IoT devices.

work.name: Turners (Soham)
work.summary: Creation of a web portal for internal use that helped with yard management and truck positioning for their main loading/repairing site.

education.institution: Instituto Superior de Engenharia de Coimbra

awards.title: Advanced Computing Projects: AI in Cloud Funding
awards.summary: Awarded 100% Computing funding with a grade of 9.22/10 for the project 'Natural Language Processing based on Graph Machine Learning and Deep Learning for Information Extraction'.
